item.title: Proclamation Celebrating the 160th Anniversary of the United States Secret Service in 2025
item.description: This proclamation commemorates the 160th anniversary of the United States Secret Service, an agency established on April 14, 1865, by President Abraham Lincoln to protect national leaders and safeguard the financial infrastructure of the United States. The document reflects on the history and evolving responsibilities of the agency since its founding. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.

item.title: Presidential Permit for South Bow (USA) LP to Operate and Maintain Pipeline Facilities at Cavalier County, North Dakota, at the International Boundary Between the United States and Canada
item.description: This document provides a presidential authorization for South Bow (USA) LP, a Delaware-registered limited partnership, to operate and maintain pipeline facilities located at Cavalier County, North Dakota, near the international boundary between the United States and Canada. The permit is issued with specific conditions outlined by the President, granting the permittee permission to carry out activities related to the pipeline within authorized boundaries. Disclaimer: This content is AI generated. Use at your own risk. Please consult the original articles for accurate information.
